result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert R Gehrke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber. Standard release conditions.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Submit to random urine screens.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

and Production Filed by Attorney Foley

Defendant Robert R Gehrke in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for the pubic defender. Defendant would like to proceed on his own and take the state's offer. Court adjourns the matter for the defendant to decide if he wants to proceed on his own and fill out the forms or he if he wants to seek counsel.  Hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Robert R Gehrke in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
